activities:
Datadog is an Information Technology (IT) monitoring service used to monitor the availability and performance of its users' IT infrastructure (e.g. web, database and application servers) .

Certain users (including current and prospective customers) choose to interact with Datadog in ways that require Datadog to gather personal information. The amount and type of information that Datadog gathers depends on the nature of the interaction.

For example, when signing up for a trial of the Service, Datadog may ask a user to provide the user’s name and the name of the user’s company, as well as an email address and telephone number where we may contact the user and/or another representative of the user’s company. Each user is also expected to provide a username and password that, along with other information, Datadog uses to create and administer accounts.

Another example is when an existing user invites a person to join Datadog. Datadog will prompt the existing user to enter the invitee's email address (but not its phone number).

In each case, Datadog collects such information only insofar as is necessary or appropriate to fulfill the purpose of the users' interaction with Datadog.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Online data includes: first and last name, organization name, email address, optional phone number
